intro: Chiococca brachiata var. genuina, commonly known as the Andean velvetleaf, is a flowering plant native to the cloud forests of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves and showy, pale yellow flowers. The plant is typically shrub-like, with woody stems and can grow up to several meters in height. Its botanical features include stellate (star-shaped) hairs on the leaves and a distinctive capsule-like fruit. It is often found in moist, shaded environments and is valued for its ornamental appeal.
